intro: Alnus subcordata, commonly known as the subcordate alder, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Betulaceae family and is characterized by its alternate, simple, and ovate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in catkins, which are typically wind-pollinated. Its seeds are enclosed in small, woody capsules that release seeds when mature. Alnus subcordata is often found in rocky or calcareous soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
